text:
Hello! I have a problem what could cause a hubdb not showing on my listing page only when I use "hsDebug=true" or "?hsCacheBuster=3388" in the link it shows the items from the hubdb

Is there like a maximum of times you can use that hubdb in the code?

The trigger you proposed seems like a solution. With the deal type we could know which email we should send (for 3 products 3 different emails), but in the API I can't find the way how to send deal type or make association to deal type.  Any idea how to do that?

We've built a full 'rep availability system' for handling skill-based bookings but it doesn't (yet) integrate with Google or Microsoft calendar. The availability has to be manually entered using a custom coded interface we built.
The availability data is stored as a custom object record rather than on the contact.

Deal Type would be via the properties.
Associations requires an associations array.
All the relevant endpoints are on this page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/objects/deals>
Thanks. In the meantime I've found how to send the dealtype as a property via API call.
From the documentation is very hard to find the properties, name / value pairs...
To get the property internal names go to Settings > Properties. Select the property and then you can see the internal name:
Is it possible to create a customized blog author page or are we limited to the default page that is auto generated? Or even just ADD TO the default page?

Hi everyone,
I have two questions to ask:
1. I have a blog post, and the featured image is causing a significant LCP (Largest Contentful Paint) issue. I've optimized the image in every possible way and used the `fetchpriority` attribute, but I'm still seeing SEO issues. What is the best way to address this problem?
2. I am using a HubSpot form in the footer, which is affecting my page speed. Is there any way to tackle this issue?
Attaching the image for better understanding.

Thank you!

Hi <@U025L73EMA6>
Yes, with `if_blog_author` statement in the blog listing template, you can add your own markup to be displayed for the author page and style it according to your needs.
More information on that is in the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/blog#if-blog-author|documentation>.

Hi everyone!
There’s a tracking code that is showing as a broken image at the bottom of each website page and landing page, I checked everywhere and I still can’t identify where it is coming from in order to remove it. Can someone please help me out?
The website is <http://cpgvision.com|cpgvision.com> and here is a screenshot for clarification. Thank you
Thank you <@UMZFZHVUJ>! I will take a look!
I just renamed it HubSpot, the repo was set up specifically for this so it wasn't a big hassle

Hi <@U077MERFKCY>,
have you checked following places:
• Pages footer HTML settings: settings(gear icon top right) -> Content -> Pages -> Templates -> "Site footer HTML" // Also check all domains in with the drop-down select above "Default settings for all domains". Might be a domain specific thing
• The pages footer HTML section: Page -> Settings -> Advanced -> Footer HTML
Yep, I tried both and it isn’t there.

For the featured image issue — Is the image content-relevant, or is it strictly decorative? For strictly decorative images, you can avoid LCP issues by setting them as CSS background images, since those aren’t a “replaced” element and won’t re-trigger the LCP timer. Just make sure you’re not sacrificing accessibility for lighthouse score!

Other things that might be causing a delayed LCP:
• Is the element animated? The LCP timer will keep re-triggering until that animation is completed.
• Is something else earlier in the page render causing the delay? The image itself might not be the problem, it might just be the last thing that’s getting recorded. Time spent on render-blocking CSS or scripts will be accounted for in your LCP time, if they’re pushing back the render of the image.
• Do you have any layout shift happening? If the image gets shifted by another element, that would cause it to re-paint, and re-trigger the LCP timer.

there is no layout shift happening.
I tried the background image approach but no luck.
No element is not animated thats a simple image
the image is relevant and needed for blogs

With regards to the HS Forms scripts bundle — that’s a pretty constant source of pain for lots of us.

A fix that I’ve heard of (but not personally implemented) is to completely disable the default “Form” module so that the forms script is never auto-bundled in your page resources. Then, you can create your own Form module that loads the forms script package, but has the “defer” attribute set on the script tag. You can then use the v2.js API to initialize any forms on the page.

A bit of a pain, but it’s doable!
can you give same link/example how to make the form module

Unfortunately, I don’t have a full example on-hand, but <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1716593870505099?thread_ts=1698279161.744019&cid=C22PU4LV8|here’s another post I made> on a related topic that goes over how to use the v2.js API to initialize forms from placeholder elements.

The rest of it shouldn’t be too tricky to figure out, though — it’s pretty much the same process as deferred loading of any CDN-hosted JS library!
